CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 22, 1945, pg. 13, reads: "VETERAN JOURNALIST VISITS COURIER - Cornelius Edwards, native of Canada, lay claim to being one of the oldest if not the oldest of Negro newspapermen. He is shown here with Earl V. Hord, Business Manager, at a Courier typesetting machine during a visit to Pittsburgh en route to Albuquerque, N. M. He says he has been in game since he was 12 years of age."
TitMainTitle: Cornelius Edwards operating typewriter or other keyboard, with Earl V. Hord, wearing pinstriped suit and moustache standing over him, at Pittsburgh Courier plant on Centre Avenue, Hill District
